sinks.name: TEE_Malloc
sinks.reason: Tainted size can cause integer wrap, insufficient or excessive allocation, enabling subsequent buffer overflows or DoS

sinks.name: TEE_ReadObjectData
sinks.reason: Destination buffer receives data; if it points to shared memory, this may leak secure object data to Normal World.

sinks.name: TEE_ReadObjectData
sinks.reason: Size controls how many bytes are written to the destination; attacker-controlled size may cause buffer overflow or logic errors.

sinks.name: strlen
sinks.reason: Unbounded read until NUL on tainted pointer can cause out-of-bounds read or fault, enabling denial-of-service and potential info leakage within TA
